string-array.item:
About Tab components

Like other UI components, a Tab component requires a name, a role, a value and a state.

This is to give screen reader users enough information about the type of the component, the name of the tab, the position of the current tab and the total number of tabs there are, and if the current tab is selected.

The utterance must announce all of these information.

Unfortunately, only the state is automatically announced when using TabLayout from support design library. It is responsibility of the developer to set each tab a content description that announces the required information.

Common mistakes in Tab components

Lack of content description

Because this behavior has not yet been implemented by default in the support design library, a lot of developers often forget to provide the required content description to each tab.

Auto focus

A common mistake developers often do is to move the accessibility focus to the content of the tab after selecting a tab. Accessibility focus must stay on the tab after being selected.

Learn more about Tab components

Look at the source of this activity and see how we\'re setting content description. You can extend the TabLayout to provide this behavior by default.

Look at the TabLayout documentation as well as using a TabHost.
